title: Recovery from an eating disorder in the United Kingdom ( UK ) 2015 , by disorder
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Categorys on X-axis for 2 groups Anorexia nervosa, and Bulimia nervosa. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of individuals.
In Category Full recovery, Anorexia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals 46.0 among the 2 groups and in Chronically ill, Anorexia nervosa had the lowest Share of individuals 20.0.
Among all the Categorys, Anorexia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals 46.0 in Category Full recovery and lowest value 20.0 in Category Chronically ill.
There is a gap of 26.0 between the highest and lowest Share of individuals found for Anorexia nervosa in Category Full recovery and Chronically ill.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of individuals on the Y-axis for 3 different Categorys for 2 groups Anorexia nervosa, and Bulimia nervosa that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 2 groups, Anorexia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals in Category Full recovery and Anorexia nervosa had the lowest Share of individuals in Category Chronically ill.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Categorys on X-axis for 2 groups Anorexia nervosa, and Bulimia nervosa. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of individuals.
In Category Full recovery, Anorexia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals 46.0 among the 2 groups and in Chronically ill, Anorexia nervosa had the lowest Share of individuals 20.0.
Among all the Categorys, Anorexia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals 46.0 in Category Full recovery and lowest value 20.0 in Category Chronically ill.
There is a gap of 26.0 between the highest and lowest Share of individuals found for Anorexia nervosa in Category Full recovery and Chronically ill.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of individuals on the Y-axis for 3 different Categorys for 2 groups Anorexia nervosa, and Bulimia nervosa that are presented on the X-axis.

Category Full recovery had the maximum Share of individuals among all 2 groups, and it was for Anorexia nervosa. The minimum Share of individuals was observed in Category Chronically ill for Anorexia nervosa.
In Category Full recovery, Anorexia nervosa had the maximum Share of individuals and it saw the lowest in Category Chronically ill out of all 3 Categorys.
Category Full recovery and Chronically ill had the biggest gap of 26.0 between the highest and lowest Share of individuals found for Anorexia nervosa.
Among all 2 groups, Anorexia nervosa had the gap of 26.0 between the maximum and minimum Share of individuals observed in Category Full recovery and Chronically ill respectively.
Averaging all 2 groups Anorexia nervosa, and Bulimia nervosa, the Category Full recovery is the maximum Share of individuals and Chronically ill is the minimum Share of individuals.
